Key Arguments: The bill breaches international treaty obligations, specifically Article 19 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
Censorship is contrary to Australian history, culture, and values.
Misinformation and disinformation have always existed and do not threaten democracy; enforced views and censorship do.
Freedom of speech is an inalienable right, and historically, censors have not been the 'good guys'.
Government censorship is unnecessary and poses a greater threat than misinformation.
There is skepticism about who would oversee fact-checking and censorship.
Notable Quotes: This attempt at censorship is a betrayal to the entire history, culture, and values, of the Australian people.
Freedom of speech is an inalienable right. Never in history have the censors been the good guys.
